alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Far Northwest Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 27 at 3:06PM MST until December 29 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER TRAVEL IMPACTS EXPECTED TONIGHT THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING IN THE NORTHERN HIGH TERRAIN... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected as well as areas of blowing and drifting snow. Total snow accumulations for the Chuska Mountains will range from 4 to 12 inches, highest over the mountain peaks. Meanwhile, 3 to 8 inches are expected below 7,000 feet across the northwest highlands with 6 to 12 inches above 7,000 feet. Wind gusts up to 45 mph will create poor visibility and areas of blowing and drifting snow, especially in the Chuska Mountains. * WHERE...Far Northwest Highlands and Chuska Mountains. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 11 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, especially along U.S. Highway 84 and State Route 134. Tire chains may be necessary if traveling through mountain passes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.
